title: Ward Tower
text: Ward Tower () is a prominent <a href="mountain">mountain</a>, , located 3 nautical miles (6 km) east-northeast of <a href="Mount%20Aldrich">Mount Aldrich</a> on the main ridge of <a href="Britannia%20Range%20%28Antarctica%29">Britannia Range</a>. Named by <a href="Advisory%20Committee%20on%20Antarctic%20Names">Advisory Committee on Antarctic Names</a> (US-ACAN) after Commander <a href="Edward%20M.%20Ward">Edward M. Ward</a>, <a href="U.S.%20Navy">U.S. Navy</a>, commanding officer of U.S. Navy Squadron <a href="VX-6">VX-6</a> during <a href="Operation%20Deep%20Freeze">Operation Deep Freeze</a> I and II, 1955–56 and 1956–57.
